text: John Francis "Jack" Jobson (30 July 1899 – 22 November 1955) was a former Australian rules footballer who played with Collingwood and Hawthorn in the Victorian Football League (VFL). Joining Collingwood from Richmond District in July 1924 he played in five consecutive games before being suspended for elbowing Steve Donnellan of Fitzroy. He made one appearance for Collingwood in 1925, unsuccessfully applied for a clearance to North Melbourne, before joining Hawthorn for the 1926 VFL season. He made only one appearance before returning to Collingwood but he failed to play another senior game. He played for Northcote in 1928 but returned to Collingwood again in 1929. == Notes == == External links == * *Jack Jobson's profile at Collingwood Forever Category:1899 births Category:1955 deaths Category:Australian rules footballers from Victoria (Australia) Category:Collingwood Football Club players Category:Hawthorn Football Club players
title: Jack Jobson
